ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to conduct research - data collection (running participants through an experiment), data analysis, task designing, scientific write-ups...
I have learned more about the neuroscience behind Alzheimer's Disease, using statistical programs to analyze empirical data, and practiced my scientific writing skills.

Learned so much about people with disabilities and the challenges they face during COVID, as well as the kinds of stressors they have. Learned more about narratives and how to code them, and how narrative constructs are appearing in every day life. Learning how to avoid my own biases and engage in a population that is different from me. Learning more how a lab works and the stages of a study.
I learned how to conduct in-person studies and just more about psych research!

Continuing to work as an RA in Julia Leonard's Developmental Psychology Lab. Learnt a ton from everyone in the lab, specifically on running my own study, analyzing data, and working through the current literature on the topic.
I learned a lot about fMRI through scanning and doing research. I found it enjoyable to participate in lab meetings. I additionally learned about preprocessing and analysis.
I learned incredible research skills in observation, writing, and investigation in this class. It was incredibly hands-on in learning.
I got to work with the best RAs and got to see how a lab is run.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Everyone is amazing and involved and I have no suggestions
Strengths include experiences of researching in psychology for current projects, and understanding of real work experience in psychology research.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, fun to do your own thing and get into what you're interested in and get credit for it.
Yes-- to get more experience in research, please try to do it for credit at least once in your time at Yale.

Yes 100% if you want to learn more about psychology/cogsci then working in a lab is a fantastic experience. 10/10 recommend Julia Leonard's lab, everyone is amazing to be around and work with, and everyone's working on super cool projects.
This is a great opportunity to learn how to do research in a hands-on way.
I would 100% recommend this class to any psychology student. There are so many different paths to take to experience real, applicable skills.
